Message.Title: Finally catching upto ibm
Message.Msg: All this company has done over the last decade is cut costs and buy back shares with cheap money to post earnings growth. There is only so much that you can cut and buy back, its finally catching up. With the new earnings how does the company react, try to sell server business, cut costs, same old thing, no long term growth plans, no new businesses, no innovations. The stock may waiver for a few more quarters but it is dead money.

Topic.Title: 2015 Road Map $20 EPS

Message.Msg: In it's usual fashion, IBM announces there will be layoffs during 2Q13. That should do the trick! Profits will bounce back to pre Palisamo/Rometty days when artificial, unattainable targets didn't exist.

Topic.Title: 2015 Road Map $20 EPS

Message.Msg: Robert Djurdjevic, head of Annex Research in Maui, Hawaii, found IBM’s report disappointing. “One cannot count on ‘financial engineering’ alone to boost profit margins. One needs new revenues. Period. No currency, tax rate, share buybacks, quarter-to-quarter overflows or other adjustments or explanations. True new business is the missing factor in IBM results.” Thank you Robert, my exact sentiment.

Topic.Title: BUFFETT Must Be Wrong

Message.Msg: agreed .. just follow some of the stocks that Buffet has owned over the past 30 years .... to a stock , every one of them had setbacks like this , yet over the long haul have made him and his minions a lot more money than most posters will ever see ..... also , Warren is still ahead on IBM and doing quite well ... one thing that concerns me , at this point , is the mammoth volume today .... price recovery will not be "V" shaped here .. it's going to take a while to claw back to 215 , but should be there by year end ... note ... if you can't ride out the storms , then don't invest , stick with money markets, or cash under the pillow if you follow drug companies , then you are well aware of "pipelines" and even if a company is struggling at a particular moment , the pipeline could be a source of strength .... anyone here know of IBM's "pipeline" ??? aside from their new practice of publishing those 5 year things of stuff deep in development , we really have to idea what's in the pipe , but history shows IBM's pipe to be one of the richest .... garce

Topic.Title: IBM Suffers Its Worst Day Since April 2005.

Message.Msg: "Why don't you check back in a year. IBM will raise its dividend next week..." IBM had an off Q1 2009 and EPS of $1.70 was up just 4% yoy -- the existing boggy of $9.20 was also just reiterated and not raised, the stock was trading around $100. But Q2 saw a catch up with EPS up 18% and the stock rose 15% to about $115 and finished the year at about $124 or up about 24%. Circumstances may not be the same in terms of the world's economic situation and demand for IT -- but IBM isn't the same either because its margins are much higher. The $3 Operating EPS just reported is 76% higher than the $1.70 EPS posted Q1 '09. Another factor is the referenced dividend increase. I don't see a boost from the extra $.45 I expect to see. IBM has to catch up later this year and lift the $16.70 or it will be dead money as far as any hope for cap gain.

Topic.Title: IBM Suffers Its Worst Day Since April 2005.
